trans-unit.source: Two-Class Logistic Regression
trans-unit.target: Two-Class Logistic Regression

trans-unit.source: Creates a two-class logistic regression model
trans-unit.target: Creates a two-class logistic regression model

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Logistic Regression</ui> module to create a logistic regression model that can be used to predict one of two states of the target variable.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Logistic Regression</ui> module to create a logistic regression model that can be used to predict one of two states of the target variable.

trans-unit.source: Logistic regression is a well-known statistical technique that is used for modeling many kinds of outcomes.
trans-unit.target: Logistic regression is a well-known statistical technique that is used for modeling many kinds of outcomes.

trans-unit.source: Classification using logistic regression is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.
trans-unit.target: Classification using logistic regression is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.

trans-unit.source: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Logistic Regression
trans-unit.target: Understanding Logistic Regression

trans-unit.source: Logistic regression is a well-known method in statistics that is used to predict the probability of an outcome.
trans-unit.target: Logistic regression is a well-known method in statistics that is used to predict the probability of an outcome.

trans-unit.source: It is popular for classification tasks.
trans-unit.target: It is popular for classification tasks.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm predicts the probability of occurrence of an event by fitting data to a logistical function.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm predicts the probability of occurrence of an event by fitting data to a logistical function.

trans-unit.source: For details about this implementation, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For details about this implementation, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Two-Class Logistic Regression</ui>, the classifier is optimized for the classification of dichotomous variables.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Two-Class Logistic Regression</ui>, the classifier is optimized for the classification of dichotomous variables.

trans-unit.source: The <link xlink:href="1d195fe5-98cd-4e1a-a1c8-076aaa3e02c3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Multiclass Logistic Regression</link> module is suited for classification of multiple outcomes.
trans-unit.target: The <link xlink:href="1d195fe5-98cd-4e1a-a1c8-076aaa3e02c3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Multiclass Logistic Regression</link> module is suited for classification of multiple outcomes.

trans-unit.source: Both modules use the same settings.
trans-unit.target: Both modules use the same settings.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Two-Class Logistic Regression Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Two-Class Logistic Regression Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the logistic regression model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the logistic regression model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the logistic regression model, such as regularization terms and memory.
trans-unit.target: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the logistic regression model, such as regularization terms and memory.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the behavior of the logistic regression model by using these settings:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the behavior of the logistic regression model by using these settings:

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Optimization tolerance
trans-unit.target: Optimization tolerance

trans-unit.source: Specify the threshold value for optimizer convergence.
trans-unit.target: Specify the threshold value for optimizer convergence.

trans-unit.source: If the improvement between iterations is less than the threshold, the algorithm stops and returns the current model.
trans-unit.target: If the improvement between iterations is less than the threshold, the algorithm stops and returns the current model.

trans-unit.source: <ui>L1 regularization weight</ui>, <ui>L2 regularization weight</ui>
trans-unit.target: <ui>L1 regularization weight</ui>, <ui>L2 regularization weight</ui>

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use for the regularization parameters L1 and L2.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use for the regularization parameters L1 and L2.

trans-unit.source: A non-zero value is recommended for both.
trans-unit.target: A non-zero value is recommended for both.

trans-unit.source: Regularization is a method for preventing overfitting by penalizing models with extreme coefficient values.
trans-unit.target: Regularization is a method for preventing overfitting by penalizing models with extreme coefficient values.

trans-unit.source: Regularization works by adding the penalty that is associated with coefficient values to the error of the hypothesis.
trans-unit.target: Regularization works by adding the penalty that is associated with coefficient values to the error of the hypothesis.

trans-unit.source: An accurate model with extreme coefficient values would be penalized more, but a less accurate model with more conservative values would be penalized less.
trans-unit.target: An accurate model with extreme coefficient values would be penalized more, but a less accurate model with more conservative values would be penalized less.

trans-unit.source: L1 and L2 regularization have different effects and uses.
trans-unit.target: L1 and L2 regularization have different effects and uses.

trans-unit.source: L1 can be applied to sparse models, which is useful when working with high-dimensional data.
trans-unit.target: L1 can be applied to sparse models, which is useful when working with high-dimensional data.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, L2 regularization is preferable for data that is not sparse.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, L2 regularization is preferable for data that is not sparse.

trans-unit.source: This algorithm supports a linear combination of L1 and L2 regularization values: that is, if <math>x = L1</math> and <math>y = L2</math>, <math>ax + by = c</math> defines the linear span of the regularization terms.
trans-unit.target: This algorithm supports a linear combination of L1 and L2 regularization values: that is, if <math>x = L1</math> and <math>y = L2</math>, <math>ax + by = c</math> defines the linear span of the regularization terms.

trans-unit.source: Different linear combinations of L1 and L2 terms have been devised for logistic regression models, such as <externalLink><linkText>elastic net regularization</linkText><linkUri>https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Elastic_net_regularization</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Different linear combinations of L1 and L2 terms have been devised for logistic regression models, such as <externalLink><linkText>elastic net regularization</linkText><linkUri>https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Elastic_net_regularization</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Memory size for L-BFGS
trans-unit.target: Memory size for L-BFGS

trans-unit.source: Specify the amount of memory to use for <newTerm>L-BFGS</newTerm> optimization.
trans-unit.target: Specify the amount of memory to use for <newTerm>L-BFGS</newTerm> optimization.

trans-unit.source: L-BFGS stands for limited memory Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shanno, and it is an optimization algorithm that is popular for parameter estimation.
trans-unit.target: L-BFGS stands for limited memory Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shanno, and it is an optimization algorithm that is popular for parameter estimation.

trans-unit.source: This parameter indicates the number of past positions and gradients to store for the computation of the next step.
trans-unit.target: This parameter indicates the number of past positions and gradients to store for the computation of the next step.

trans-unit.source: This optimization parameter limits the amount of memory that is used to compute the next step and direction.
trans-unit.target: This optimization parameter limits the amount of memory that is used to compute the next step and direction.

trans-unit.source: When you specify less memory, training is faster but less accurate.
trans-unit.target: When you specify less memory, training is faster but less accurate.

trans-unit.source: Random number seed
trans-unit.target: Random number seed

trans-unit.source: Specify a seed for the algorithm if you want the results to be repeatable over runs.
trans-unit.target: Specify a seed for the algorithm if you want the results to be repeatable over runs.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: Select this option to create an additional “unknown” level in each categorical column.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to create an additional “unknown” level in each categorical column.

trans-unit.source: Any levels (values) in the test dataset that are not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
trans-unit.target: Any levels (values) in the test dataset that are not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Network intrusion detection</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525724</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses binary logistic regression to determine whether a case represents an intrusion or not.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Network intrusion detection</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525724</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses binary logistic regression to determine whether a case represents an intrusion or not.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Validation for Binary Classifier</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525735</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of logistic regression in a typical experimental workflow, including model evaluation.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Validation for Binary Classifier</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525735</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of logistic regression in a typical experimental workflow, including model evaluation.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Logistic regression assumes a <newTerm>logistic distribution</newTerm> of the data, where the probability that an example belongs to class 1 is the formula:
trans-unit.target: Logistic regression assumes a <newTerm>logistic distribution</newTerm> of the data, where the probability that an example belongs to class 1 is the formula:

trans-unit.source: <math>p(x;</math>β<subscript>0</subscript>,…, β<subscript>D-1</subscript><math>)</math>
trans-unit.target: <math>p(x;</math>β<subscript>0</subscript>,…, β<subscript>D-1</subscript><math>)</math>

trans-unit.source: Where:
trans-unit.target: Where:

trans-unit.source: <math>x</math> is a <math>D-</math>dimensional vector containing the values of all the features of the instance.
trans-unit.target: <math>x</math> is a <math>D-</math>dimensional vector containing the values of all the features of the instance.

trans-unit.source: <math>p</math> is the logistic distribution function.
trans-unit.target: <math>p</math> is the logistic distribution function.

trans-unit.source: β<subscript>{0}</subscript>,..., β <subscript>{D-1}</subscript> are the unknown parameters of the logistic distribution.
trans-unit.target: β<subscript>{0}</subscript>,..., β <subscript>{D-1}</subscript> are the unknown parameters of the logistic distribution.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm tries to find the optimal values for β<subscript>{0}</subscript>,..., β <subscript>{D-1}</subscript> by maximizing the log probability of the parameters given the inputs.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm tries to find the optimal values for β<subscript>{0}</subscript>,..., β <subscript>{D-1}</subscript> by maximizing the log probability of the parameters given the inputs.

trans-unit.source: Maximization is performed by using a popular method for parameter estimation, called <externalLink><linkText>Limited Memory BFGS</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited-memory_BFGS</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Maximization is performed by using a popular method for parameter estimation, called <externalLink><linkText>Limited Memory BFGS</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited-memory_BFGS</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the implementation of this algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>Scalable Training of L-1 Regularized Log-Linear Models</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=78900</linkUri></externalLink>, by Andrew and Gao.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the implementation of this algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>Scalable Training of L-1 Regularized Log-Linear Models</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=78900</linkUri></externalLink>, by Andrew and Gao.
